Overall, the entire game is very playable, up through the final cutscene.

There were dips in performance, but not too often and typically not major enough to severely impact gameplay.

The more problematic glitches observed include:
-Leaving xemu on in the background (est. 10-30 minutes) with this game running can lead to the game freezing, necessitating a restart via the xemu menus
-UI flickering, sometimes with UI elements being replaced with erroneous assets e.g. different parts of the targeting reticle replaced by machine gun icons
-Characters getting stuck along walls - unsticking without reloading/restarting can be hard
-Restarting a level can make the grenade launcher unusable - can fix by dropping exactly one launcher
-Game freezing/corrupt save files when saving in the Dome
-Bringing up a menu immediately as you are given control for the very last time during the last level may result in xemu becoming unresponsive, necessitating that the process be killed

After turning off Threaded Optimization, setting refresh rate to 
Application Controlled, AND setting Power Management Mode to "Prefer
Maximum Performance", the game will run up to an almost consistent 54-60fps on
1-to-1 matches on the map "Fury" via Instant Action, with only some minor
dips into the 40s  - The higher the bot count, and the larger the map size, the
more dips in performance, obviously, however it's a lot less poor than 
without the prior changes through the Nvidia Control Panel - Upscaling the game 
will also bring the framerate down substantially, with the performance dropping down
 to 20fps with 2x upscaling enabled - From what I've played of the campaign so far,
which was from the opening tutorial to the first tourney match with Darius, the 
performance was a little more inconsistent, specifically during the opening
tutorial in which the framerate hung around 30-45, and during the Darius fight, where
the performance would rise to 60 and dip as low as 15. 
Overall, almost UC1 performance!

The game frame rate varies during cutscene runs at full speed but can drop to 20 fps
depending on what rendering(30fps cap). During the horse races, it tends to run at 
full speed with no noticeable dips. The only problem I encountered was shadows 
rendering incorrectly in horse races. The menu works as intended. The only main 
issue that affects gameplay heavily was the fps in the sim/free-roaming portion of
the game, which causes heavy frame dips to the mid-teens depending on the area.
This only occurs at shibusawa stables, but haven't tested all locations because I 
have no advanced far enough in the game. Other bugs include, dynamic shadows
were not rendering on the main character, the horse inspection screen, and the
destination select screen backgrounds were a solid color and not semi-transparent
like hw. Also The game Freezes after one of the first cutscenes.

The game can be playable from start to finish but has one major bug, making it difficult to progress through a portion of the game. Firstly the FMV's and main menus function as intended with no noticeable bugs. Once in-game, there is an issue with the way and shadows and lighting work. It only becomes apparent once you get the flashlight, then stay present thought out the rest of the game. It a lighting issue with how the flashlight works, which causes the light is mirrored in front, sides, and behind the player model. This has an affects on the atmosphere of the game, as well as breaking one of the puzzles in the Labyrinth, the Rotating Cube Puzzle(light is not shined no the object properly https://silenthill.fandom.com/wiki/Rotating_Cube_Puzzle?file=Block_Puzzle.png), making it hard to progress without guessing.
